ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: We discussed interesting and relevant ethics topics and this definitely will help in the future when we have to deal with challenging scientific relationships and lab dynamics.
I learned several important topics in the realm of scientific ethics.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: Addresses current ethical topics and prepares students to face challenges in lab

The academia/private business session was extremely useful, so was the "choosing a mentor." Some other one's were interesting, but many were a general misuse of time. The weekly responses and the final paper were not helpful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. It is a course everyone should take to be aware of issues of the past and present and how to deal with them.

No, in general this course was self-explanatory. They could have a sessions with students about picking a mentor appropriately, as this isn't really an ethical issue. The business session was very insightful though.
